channel.title: Posts on Peter Finnerty
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Peter Finnerty

item.title: Explanatory and Predictive Models in R
item.description: This is my final presentation for Analytics and Business Intelligence, a course I completed during my senior year at BC. In this project, my team and I attempted to best Zillow’s predictive models. I used linear regressions to explain what causes home prices and predictive models (Logistic, Naive Bayes, and Decision Tree) to guess highly priced homes. Here is the dataset used for this project, which is from Kaggle and focues on King County, Washington.

item.title: Oxford MPI Data
item.description: MPI Background MPI scores represent the best operationalized non-income based approach to measuring poverty. It measures acute poverty, including those who are poor due to absolute deprivation in one necessity and those who experience multiple forms of deprivation that result in poverty. This approach captures the spirit of Amartya Sen’s idea of shifting from income-based poverty metrics to a capabilities understanding of poverty and deprivation. For an overview of the issues with income-based poverty metrics and the importance of other measures, see Laderchi, Saith, and Stewart (2003).
